Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price (but take earplugs!)”
Reviews.Author: happytravla99
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the Mayo Inn are good - the reception area is clean, modern looking and beautifully air-conditioned after the heat and humidity on the street. The reception staff are friendly and happy to help or to give advice. I stayed with my mum in a family room - we chose it because it had a double and a single bed. It wasn't huge, but a good size for the price, included a nice tv, desk, wardrobe, drawers - everything you'd need basically! There was also a fridge, bottled water and a kettle with tea and coffee. Everything looked clean, well maintained and new. The bathroom was very well fitted out with a lovely shower and very clean. But a bit strange thing is that it's partioned off from the rest of the room with a large, frosted glass barrier - practically see-through and very difficult to get any privacy! The hotel was well located and very easy to get around - a perfect base for exploring Singapore! Being a smaller hotel, many of the taxi drivers did not know where it was, but usefully it was opposite the Sim Lim Tower, so this is a good landmark to ask for! We had a good stay here - it's not luxury but it is a well appointed, very clean and friendly hotel. However there was one drawback we found - the noise! It's on a busy main road - our room overlooked this and the traffic was busy and non-stop. There is currently also a building site nearby and we could hear construction noise throughout the working day. The constant drone was very irritating (especially when suffering from jetlag!) but with a good pair of earplugs I didn't find that it interrupted my sleep any. One other minor gripe - although the wifi is free, it is very poor and unreliable. I was not able to connect in my room and judging by the number of other laptop/ tablet users who were hovering in reception, I was not the only one. Even when I was connected the service was very poor and keep dropping out - not so bad for very casual use, but really not workable if internet access is essential. So, in summary, I would definitely stay here again - the cost vs location vs comfort is great - but I will be packing my earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, but no window - ok for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Olie92
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 2 nights in Feb-12. Chose the hotel because of the location and rather good review at tripadvisor. At SGD110, hard to find better value in Singapore these days. The only minus is probably the no-window room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Minimalist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickpj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent three days at the Mayo Inn, Singapore. I am at a bit of a loss as to how to describe the Mayo as we both enjoyed our stay but also felt it had some serious deficiencies On the positive side, the Mayo is inexpensive by Singapore standards. It is reasonably well located in Little India, close to shopping, food courts and transportation. The rooms, all equipped with refrigerators, are extremely clean and the staff is pleasant and helpful. The air conditioning is very effective and unobtrusive. Free Wifi and ethernet connections are available. (For us the Wifi only worked in the lobby.) However be aware that this is a minimalist hotel. - The rooms contain a bed with two pillows. - The only chair is a rickety little stool with no back. - The bathroom supplies do not include hand soap, tissues, hand towels, face cloths or a hair dryer. - There is no telephone in the room. - There is no safe in the room or at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our travels!”
Reviews.Author: LuIan
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel based on location (very near to the Little India tube station...very fun and vibrant area of town!) and price (very reasonably priced compared to many hotels in Singapore). We stayed in this hotel on 2 separate occasions during our time in Singapore. The first time we booked the roof terrace room, the most expensive of all rooms. First impressions were great: super friendly receptionist, very helpful and ready to provide us with a map of the city. The bathroom was also brilliant: clean, white, spacious and modern with a walk-in, outside shower. For our second stay we opted for one of the cheaper 'Japanese style' rooms. This room had the same style, brilliant bathroom. The rest of the room was styled exceptionally well and was again, extremely clean and well laid out. I would not hesitate to stay here if back in SIngapore. If you want a flawless hotel at a very reasonable price, this is definitely the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Best You can Find at this price in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Lempert
Reviews.Content: Since the price in Singapore are very high, this hotel is the best we could find for about $100 per night. Rooms are basic and noisy. Little India isn't the best district for tourists, but it's the cheapest one. The hotel looks much better than surrounding hotels. Internet is very slow, you'd better buy a SIM card for 3G internet. There is no breakfast. Very basic services, but you're in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in pricy Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ilocanotraveller
Reviews.Content: Mayo Inn is situated at the tip of Little India. It is across Hotel 81 on one side and Sim Lim Tower on the other. The nearest MTR station is about 10 minutes away. Since I was with family, we chose to commute by taxi. The room we got was at the ground floor. It wasn't noisy and it didn't smell cigarette smoke, which was good. I noticed the room had a Japanese theme because the bed was close to the floor. The bed was wide enough to accommodate my wife, 2-year old and myself. There's a closet, a mini-ref, and complimentary water, tea, and instant coffee. There's a flatscreen TV with a few channels (not a big deal since I'm not there for the cable). Then there's free wifi with normal speed. I liked the bathroom. The shower area was spacious (no curtains, but the showerhead was far enough from the toilet bowl for that area not to get wet). There's a Mcdonalds about 5 minutes away (Unfortunately, the hotel does not serve breakfast). Overall, like what the other reviewers said, Mayo Inn is a clean, quiet, no-frills budget hotel in expensive Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: s_v_murray76
Reviews.Content: The double western style room was clean, with the sink in the room and clean en-suite shower/toilet. There were small bedside tables; a fridge and tea/coffee making facilities along with bottles of water that were replaced daily. There was a small stool and TV, with a makeshift clothes hanger above the fridge made from some railing. The main problem with this hotel was the amount of street noise that could be heard from the room. The windows seemed to have gaps in them, but were locked and it was almost as if there were no windows at all. Also the lift had no Inner door, but had sensors so it would stop if you went near where a door usually is. This hotel also has A/C and free Wi-Fi, but no restaurant or Breakfast, but the price was good. The hotel is located on the edge of Little India and is easily within 10 minutes walk of the Bugis MRT station, therefore making it easy and cheap to reach using MRT from the airport. The MRT was also useful for getting around the city. Although no food was available at the hotel, there was a small 24 hour convenience store across the road and many bars/cafes/restaurants within a few minutes walk of the hotel. At the time we stayed (February 2012) there was construction works going on approximately 100 metres of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Myka_Francisco
Reviews.Content: Average rooms. Got the very clean Japanese-inspired room, which was basically a mattress on the floor (well, an elevated part of the floor.) It was a small room, just the right size for 2 of us. Weird semi-opaque bathroom door and walls where you can see the silhouette of anyone using the toilet or shower. Brought our own stuff so we didn't have to use the industrial strength shampoo and shower gels they usually provide in hotels. TV in room which we barely used. Basic coffee and tea corner replenished daily. Small refrigerator. No compartment for your bags but we only stayed there for a couple of nights, so it was no problem. There were windows, but were bolted from the outside and were covered with heavy drapery. Street can be noisy, but noise dies at night save for the occasional motorcycle. I don't think there was a restaurant. No space where you can meet other travelers as well. Location was perfect. 24-hour convenience store right in front of the hotel. Short walk to Bugis Station and Little India. It's value for your money in a very expensive city, but don't expect much.

Reviews.Title: “feedback of stay at Mayo Inn on 21 Jan 2012”
Reviews.Author: leena d
Reviews.Content: I am an Austraian citizen who visited Singapore on 21 jan 2012. I wanted to do my shopping at Mustafa Centre in Little India. Althought the Fortuna Hotel was located just opposite to Mustafa, this is a worst hotel. After intensive research to find a hotel accomodation near Little India, I read the guest reviews about Mayo Inn (located opposite Sim Lim Tower) , and booked a family room for two days. The staff named Ana was very helpful and contacted her my email prior to leaving Sydney. There is no need to pay advance payment for booking as they accept only cash payment. An email confirmation of booking is sufficient. I reached Singapore at 7 am but the check in was at 2pm. I explained to the staff on duty that we travelled for 8hours by plane and we need a room if it is vacant. At 7:30am on same day the room was given to us. All basic required facilities was available at this hotel but the drawbacks I could see in this hotel was there were plenty of ants on the bed and everywhere. The hotel is located on the main road and close to basic amenities. Although I earlier requested for a quiet room, which the hotel staff confirmed with me by email that it would be given to me, but I got a noisy room(room no. 305) located at the roadside. In the toilet there is no sliding door to seperate the shower screen and the toilet and the whole area gets wet. There is no bathroom mat at the door entry of the toilet. There is no mini micorwave to re-heat food where such facility is provided in all other hotels and also in motels. There is no phone inside the room or intercom to contact the reception for any needs. There is a mini fridge in the family room. Overall it was a good stay if you wish to stay for two days. But the price for family room per night is SGD $150 which is bit expensive for those facilities provided by the hotel and not worth for the price we pay. I rate as average for the value for money. If you are not concerned about the price, I would recommend this hotel to any travellers especially if you want to go to Mustafa Centre located at Syed Alwi Road. If you love Indian food, you can go to Anjappar restaurant(both veg and non veg) located just opposite to .Mustafa centre or visit Saravanna bhavan or Anand bhavan. I went with my family and amongst these restuarant we liked the food from Anjappar hotel and the food is very cheap that they give us too much food which we cannot eat. So order for few dishes first to save money. The travelling distance by walk from Mayo Inn to Mustafa is 10 to 15 minutes but we took a taxi and cost SGD $4 to $5 depending on the time of travel. But all these shops would be open only from 11am onwards. Only Anandbhavan hotel is open by 9am and Mustafa open 24 hours. This is a genuine feedback from me and am not writing for any promotional offer. This would assist any travellers going to Singapore. Beware of pickpocketing near Mustafa centre. -L Denny Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Quiet, Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: orionqt
Reviews.Content: 3 of us shared a family room. The room had enough space for 3 of us girls with all our sports gear and clothes. The bathroom was very clean and comfortable, the room was clean and sheets were clean. I enjoyed the lift - we got stuck on our first day as we weren't following instructions to the T. But we got the hang of it pretty quickly. Even though there were other people on the same floor/storey as us, we didn't hear them.. Sound proofing was quite good! Lobby is small but cute and whoever was at the desk was always helpful. Only 2 negative things - the hallways/corridors are a bit small and narrow so when trying to get into our room with all our luggage, it was a tight squeeze while we were trying to unlock the door. and the last negative thing - one time we went down to the lobby where we were met with an awful stench. The person at the front desk was having her lunch at her desk and it was some really exotic thing that stunk up the entire lobby!!! But the negatives were not enough to counter the positives - i would stay at Mayo Inn again....

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SusanNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The best part of the hotel was the location, walking distance to Little India and the train station, etc.The elevator was not functioning correctly. The room is really bare bones, windows dark and covered.Uncomfortable bed. Bring your own soap though bath gel and shampoo was provided. Did not get any sleep as little children were running back and forth through all hours of the night and street noise early in the morning. We only stayed one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: syddy6andmaddy2
Reviews.Content: The Mayo Inn was perfect for a weeks stay in Singapore for a family of 4. We had a family room which was very reasonably priced and spotlessly clean. The AC was wickedly efficient and the TV was the usual SE Asia standard. As mentioned by others, there is some traffic noise but it was more of a familiar background rumble and certainly did not keep us awake. The Hotel is located right on the edge of Little India opposite the Sim Lim Tower. Taxi were always available just outside the hotel and most places of interest were a SD$10-15 ride away. Some taxis had not heard of the Mayo Inn or Mayo street on which it is located but this was not a problem as all knew where the Sim Lim Tower was. Two (very minor) points which should be highlighted. The lift is a little strange, having no inner door. My youngest was a little frightened to use it. The bathroom had frosted glass doors/walls which was no problem for me but not private enough for my two teenage daughters... I would definately go back again. Should mention the wonderful (and cheap) street cafes just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay with family”
Reviews.Author: eirian1812
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights early January with family of four, 2 adults and 2 children. Paid $180 as we needed an extra bed. A basic hotel, clean and friendly and fine for a short stay in expensive Singapore. We had great difficulty finding a hotel which catered for families of 4 at a reasonable price even though we booked 3 months in advance. The location, though noisy, on the edge of Little India, is great if you like to be in the middle of things. There is a great little Chinese food shop up the road which was reasonably priced for drinks and snacks. Loved Little India Arcade for all your touristy bargain buys, just 5 - 10 mins from the hotel. Our room on the third floor faced the front and had coloured glass windows which we could not open. It was very noisy however after walking around Singapore all day in the heat we slept through it all! The beds though were extremely hard and rather uncomfortable. On a plus point they have free internet and efficient air condition and we felt safe. The lift is a little odd and has no door so if you accidently touch the gap where the door should be it automatically stops. We managed to do this twice! I would definitely recommend it for a short stay of 2 nights, possibly three if you are looking at the cheaper range of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “we will definitely come back by alain”
Reviews.Author: haredevil
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated near bugis and this is what i really love about this hotel. the service is exceptional, anna and eric is very helpful. the rates are just reasonable on an expensive place like singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good for families”
Reviews.Author: percusso
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the 'Japanese rooms' and were very impressed with the decor, lighting and layout. Our 1-year-old baby also loved it and it was very safe for him to play in (no bed to fall off etc!). There was enough room to put up our travel cot. The location is excellent, right near Little India, Sim Lim Square and the MRT station. The staff were very friendly, helpful and welcoming. We will definitely stay at the Mayo Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Remodel and Update recently”
Reviews.Author: MGMTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayo Inn based on Tripadvisor Reviews. We found that our experience was different than some of the reviews. We were on the third floor, and didn't have much street noise. We chose the Japanese Concept room, and found it very comfortable. We were curious if the restroom would be Western or Asian. Western. The rooms do conform to some unusual shapes of the building - but no problem. Fridge and teapot were great. Good Flat Screen TV with assortment of languages. Good shower and bathroom area. The Inn is close to the large Electronics Shopping Center. Good food and shopping in the area. The subway wasn't too far away - 3 or 4 blocks. Taxis aren't very expensive. Good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job, no more, but also no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: skiesnpies
Reviews.Content: We did our usual 4x people to a room (2x kids and 2x adults) and were given an odd shaped room but one which fitted us in without any problems. The rooms were spotless and functional but without much gloss, perfect in fact for what we needed, somewhere to sleep after sight seeing and shopping. The road noise is a little troublesome but again, big cities are noisy places and the Marina Bay Sands was quieter but also double the price! You pays yer money and you takes your choice. The location was fairly good, finding it the first time took a while until we realised it was directly underneath the Sim Lim tower - which everyone knows. There are loads of good Indian food places nearby if thats your thing. I would probably be happy to stay again all things considered.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night”
Reviews.Author: AMFMNewZealand
Reviews.Content: It's probably reasonable value for Singapore standards. Did our family for the night. But really really noisy road (on 2nd floor) so not much sleep had and a small, odd shaped room. Just a placed to bunk down. Clean and adequate facilities. Felt safe with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for me”
Reviews.Author: Dragan P
Reviews.Content: Clean, near to any transportation, near to shoping centre, exellent ataff, many regards

Reviews.Title: “Good value in expensive Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Traveller143
Reviews.Content: We took a taxi from the airport and although the driver did not have trouble finding the area, he had trouble finding the place itself as the signage wasn't too visible. He let us off a block away with our luggage in tow and the first person we asked on the street did not know where it was. Thankfully, we had our free map from the airport so we walked in the right direction and found the place about 5 minutes later. It was a pleasant feeling walking into the air-conditioned lobby. I handed over our reservation details as e-mailed by the staff earlier and was told that our reservation was not until the following day. I could not be wrong so I pointed out to her the dates as indicated on the printed receipt they had e-mailed. Fortunately, she saw that I was right. Unfortunately, at 3:30pm, our room was not ready yet. We just headed out for lunch at a nearby hawker center and when we returned around 4:00pm, our room was ready. We booked a family room with an extra bed because there were 4 of us. Our room was clean and spacious enough for all of us. It was also well-lighted. It had windows that were bolted shut so we couldn't open them. We were not too concerned with that. Besides, we imagined it would be noisy outside so that might have helped mute out the noise, which we didn't hear while we were there. The ventilation was good despite that because my personal quick-drying towel dried up overnight. It doesn't do that in rooms that have poor ventilation. The air-conditioner worked well too. The beds were comfortable and the sheets were clean. We only had a pillow each. Said pillows were kinda weird. They looked fluffy but were not really fluffy as my head would sink into them when I lay down. Complimentary coffee, tea and bottled water were replenished daily when the room was cleaned. The small refrigerator worked properly. The LCD TV only had a few channels but it was tolerable because it had CNN and Discovery channel. The bathroom was also clean and spacious. Fresh towels were provided daily. Some basic toiletries were also on hand. The bathroom door was an opaque kind of glass but we weren’t bothered with it because it was really opaque i.e., you could only see that there's a person inside but could not even make out it if was male or female. Besides, it did not face the room and we just agreed among ourselves that should one be in the bathroom, the others just don't linger in the area. The water pressure was ok and the hot water worked perfectly. Everyday one had to have the keycard updated with the front desk. Otherwise, the door to the room cannot be opened with it. We found it scary at first to use the lift but after a few hits and fewer misses, we got the hang of it. As for the staff, they were prompt in answering e-mail inquiries. In person, with a little bit of effort, we could understand each other's English well. They were friendly and helpful. Mayo Inn is in a good location. Right across its front door is a 24-hour convenience store that has friendly staff. We could also choose between either Bugis or the Little India stations of the MRT whenever we had to take the train. They were about a 10-minute moderate-paced walk away. Getting taxis was also not a problem in the area. Lastly, hawker stalls and fast-food chains were near. Because of Sim Lim Square's reputation, although it was near Mayo inn, we did not go there anymore. P.S. The pictures of the rooms look a bit better on the website (the rooms are photogenic) so don't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: omoinoyukue
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights while arriving at 2am in the morning for the first night. Originally booked a Jap concept room on 2nd floor and specifically asked for a quiet room, but our room had this big window and was close to the main road, and couldn't sleep well during the first night with people talking on the street at 5am. Changed to a room with no window on the ground floor the next day, and everything looks good. Excellent service, good location @ Little India & Bugis with a bit of a walk to MRT, and an enjoyable stay overall. A good choice if you are looking for a boutique & budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, good location and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Renjana2
Reviews.Content: I was stay there with my big family and it's an enjoyable stay. The hotel is not to big --so did the room-- but clean and neat, gave me impression of more like a personal hotel. My fave thing is the location, it's close to 24-hour convenient store and within walking distance to busy Bugis street, lively Little India and artistic Kampong Glam.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for a budget stay in singapore”
Reviews.Author: SGD1987
Reviews.Content: Hi, i'm a Local singaporean who book a night stay in mayo inn. It's actually located at jalan besar, next to the hotel 81, opposite the sim lim square, and it's minutes of walking distance to the cultural site of little India, shopping district in Bugis street and night out chilling in bars or enjoying "sheeshas" and Mediterranean food & culture in Arab streets. Yes, it's very near a major construction site for it's circle line metro/subway or commonly called MRT project. Some may find it disturbing, but personally, i dont really hear it and had a peaceful night sleep. Booking wise, have to email them your particulars and pay them via paypal if you are checking in after 5pm. Otherwise, payment can be made upon checking in at 2pm via credit cards or cash. I booked a deluxe Japanese style room at $130/- it is located at level 1 itself. It's a small inn. Staffs were friendly. Room was slightly small for a deluxe room. And no attached windows, so it was a enclosed room. The interesting part thou would be the room set up, you William be greeted with short flight of stairs, wooden shades hiding the bed on the left and the tv facing you directly. Toilet was great, interesting layout. We love the toilet. Toiletries are provided Inc towels. Downside would be their tv channels are limited, abt 8 channels in total. Their pillow case are the same ones in our local hospital, its rough and disposable type. Otherwise the rest is fine. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but small and noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Anwil51
Reviews.Content: Located close to good local food and markets but the road noise was bad. Room was small and not well designed.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Warren B
Reviews.Content: After looking at many of the big motels in Singapore we decided on the Mayo Inn. We booked a balcony room for seven nights which was quite comfortable and cleaned daily. The bathroom was roomy and clean. The staff were very helpful obliging. The area is so handy to just about everything you would need. With an amazing amount of eating places and shopping to be had in a very sort walk from the motel. It is right on the edge of Little India and a sort walk to Bugis village and the MRT. Which made it so easy to get to any other part of Singapore we wanted to visit. It is a little noisy around that area but that is to be expected when you are staying in the middle of a big city. I would have to say it is value for money and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better Options Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: MIWSing
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stopover and we thought this inexpensive hotel sounded like a good option and close to the Little India area. However, there were too many downsides with this hotel which would make me choose elsewhere next time. Initially when I tried to book the hotel (calling from overseas), I received the following blunt response on the phone "Too busy - call back" - so it was hardly a good start. When we arrived, it looked clean but basic in the foyer. We were in a standard room (SGD 110 per night) and we had booked 2 rooms. Both were on Level 2 and on the Jalan Besar side (the main road it's situated on) - and this was very very noisy! The rooms were tiny - too tiny. There rooms only had the basics - 2 towels and 1 bathmat - all threadbare - in fact the bath mat had 2 big holes in it - and there were no facewashers and no handtowels. The bathroom tried to be groovy as it was a green glass room within the bedroom- but functionally it didn't work - it certainly provided no privacy if you were using the loo, and if in the shower, water went everywhere as it was just too small. There was barely enough room to open 1 suitcase, let alone both of our suitcases. The room is just physically too small to hold 2 people - and barely big enough for 1 person. The wireless didn't work whilst we were there but there was a cable to connect to the internet which did work, thank goodness. The hotel is quite new but I'd hate to go there in a few months time as one can see that the maintenance is very bad - our toilet roll holder was falling off the wall, there were cigarette burns in the carpet and obviously something had been changed in the bathroom area as there was a big unpainted section and remnants of a fixture that had been removed. There was no hairdryer (lucky I had brought one with me). So all in all - I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small upgraded hotel with lift”
Reviews.Author: Vegetarian4ever
Reviews.Content: UP TO 20 MINUTES WALKING WITH LUGGAGE TO NEAREST METRO STATION (BUGIS) depending on your walking speed. Need to cross a busy road to reach at traffic lights. Recently renovated so prices have gone up. Last time I checked it was starting around Sg $110 a night. Near a mosque so can get disturbed from your sleep early!!. Near night Massage parlour. Opposite hotel 81 Very Small but clean hotel and of course, no swimming pool. Have security cams.

Reviews.Title: “stayed there twice and would come again!”
Reviews.Author: JuDowillFutter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayo Inn in Singapore at the beginning and at the end of our trip trough Malaysia, each stay for 4, respective 3 nights. Location: The hotel is located very centrally in Little India. The MRT stations Bugis and Little India can easily be reachend within a few minutes, though if you don't mind walking you can also reach orachard road, the Naional Museum and the waterfront within a fair distance... As the hotel is near a mosque you might wake up at 5AM, when the muezzin calls. We didn't mind this, though... Hotel itself: Cleanliness is very good, the rooms are cleaned and the bedlinen and towels changed every day, same applieas to the complimentary tea, (instant) coffee and water within the rooms. In the bathrooms you'll find shampoo and shower gel as well. Though european we decided to go for a japanese style room - these are really nice! There's alo a fridge and a TV on the room, though we didn't need them. WiFi is available but sometimes a bit slow... The staff is professionally friendly - when we checked in the secondtime we were in Singapore, we arrived at 6.00 AM in the morning, and although check-in time is only at 12.00PM, the let us check into our room without any extra charge. A large thumbs-up for that and many thanks again! Rates are 110S$, but if you pay by paypal, you'll receive a discount of 10S$ per night. I'd recommend this hotel to friends and would stay there again if I'd come back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Great service”
Reviews.Author: jthendra
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Mayo on Jun 20 - 27, 2011 with my family (3 adults, 2 child). We took the family room (#305) with additional extra bed so we have 1 double and 2 single beds. The room still have adequate spaces for us to put things and move around. The room is nice with twi bigs windows (cannot open though), a television set, a big desk, two small desk beside the bed, one big wardrobe and a refrigerator also with a nice bathroom. The room is clean and eventhough it's right beside the busy street we all can sleep nicely at night. An incident happened in my family at my hometown (Jakarta) that make us to shortened the vacation and comeback to Jakarta on Jun 24th. We already paid the rate for the whole duration, so we just check out and inform the receptionist the reason why we do early check out - the following day we receive email from Mayo (Evelyn) mentioned that they will give us full refund for the remaining days. We really appreciate this; it's above our expectation. So thanks to Evelyn and Ana, who help us a lot in the reservation. Mayo Inn surely our #1 choice when we back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Ela019
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June for 4 nights the room was spacious, clean, they will come and change sheets everyday and replenish tea coffee and 2 bottle of complimentary water. The bathroom was big and they will supply everything you need shower gel, shampoo shower cap including toothbrush and paste kit, no soap. Again they will change your towels each day. We had a deluxe room and had access from our room to a backyard which we really liked but if don't want any lizards to come inside keep the door closed. For the rate we paid the service and the cleanliness exceed expectation. Cons. There was a construction site one street from the hotel just opposite Hotel 81 and the noise was horrific they are working 24/7 so do not expect any relief from it. We arrived after an 11 hours flight and we weren't able to get any sleep in the first night. We asked to change the room but the hotel was full so we had to endure honking and shouting and steel being dragged around each night and we bought ear plugs which allowed us to have a bit of sleep. I did asked for a quiet room when I booked and they gave us one away from the main road but I never anticipated the construction site will be near by. I would say it is value for money in a very expensive Singapore and I would recommend the deluxe room as is big and has a bathroom to suit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, good service, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AnnettinaH
Reviews.Content: Even on a very short stay (one night while in transit in Singapore), I was impressed by the service, staff's friendliness, and cleanliness of the room. My husband stayed there longer and also liked it. Prior to arrival, our trip plan kept changing but they very kindly accommodated our requests. Singapore is an expensive city, but Mayo Inn gives value for money (judging from the prices of similar hotels). Easy to get around and if you like gadgets: Sim Lim Square is just across the street. No breakfast at the hotel, but food is one thing Singapore's not lacking, at any time of the day (and night). Also, free WiFi, although not the fastest connection. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “As seen as the pictures and as told as the previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: Rintul
Reviews.Content: The day I arrived at Mayo Inn, i was a bit worried to see the busy noisy road and the road construction nearby. Would it be okay for us n especially for our 8mo baby asleep at night. Turned out we passed out and slept through the night. We even missed to hear the door bell rings for so many times. We stayed at the family room for 2 nights, overall the room is clean, the bathroom is great, the service is nice, even the elevator is 'cute'. Recommended if you're looking for a budget hotel at the Bugis area and convenient for family. It's 10min walk to Bugis MRT, Bugis junction, Mustafa, Bras Basah or Little India. It's recommended

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value for money place”
Reviews.Author: islaparadis
Reviews.Content: in a otherwise expensive singapore this place turned to be a gem . recently renovated , the hotel was small but had a cozy feel to it. the rooms were clean , bathroom was good, and above all, they were of a decent size.decor was minimalistic but tastefully done. front desk staff was very helpful and always had a smile on their face. would give full marks to them. there were 3 ladies at the front desk at different times of the day and all of them were wonderful.these were the only staff i saw during my 4 day stay. this hotel has a very unique lift.theres also a small convinience store right opposite where you can stock up on your daily requirements. 2 bottles of water and coffee /tea was replenished every day. the room has a flat screen with a couple of english channels and a mini fridge.bath gels , toothbrush and shampoo were provided.all in all this was the best budget hotel i have stayed in, throughtout my journey thru sotheast asia this time round.bugis mrt was a 10min walk while little india mrt was a 15 min walk. lot of dining options down the road. this hotel was opp the sim lim tower and next to hotel 81 rochor

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money in Otherwise Expensive Singapore”
Reviews.Author: andy_quality
Reviews.Content: Can easily rely upon this Hotel if you are looking out for a comfortable stay within reasonable price in Singapore. Its a proper hotel (not a backpackers inn) with all the modern amenities. The staffs are helpful & the hotel is an absolute value for money. Only drawback is the distance from Little India MRT which is abt15 mins walk...We booked the hotel through a travel agent(3rd Planet Tours) in Kolkata.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Electronics”
Reviews.Author: Vegetarian4ever
Reviews.Content: Mayo Inn is under major renovation as far I am aware until April 2010 It is near a Mosque so this may awake you. Ironically near a 'massage' parlour with a seedy back alley. Opposite Hotel 81 which is more expensive. Very near a noisy main road and traffic lights. Can walk to a western bar at night. May have to walk up to 15 minutes to an MRT Depending on yuor Luggage size. This is a budget place but is getting an upgrade so an expected hike in room rates to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: blooms_gardens
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading tripadvisor's reviews. Our only requirement is affordability, safety, cleanliness and location. Selling point of this Inn is its location. In front of Sim Lim Tower and Sim Lim Square, so if you are into gadgets this is a very good place to stay. Second, the area is surrounded by shopping malls / shops and not too far from Orchard Road. The building itself is old with no lifts/elevator. Reception area is on the 2nd floor. Rooms are on the 2nd and 3rd floor. The room we got has and attahced bathroom and has 2 beds - 1 queen and 1 single. It has TV but no cable. The bathroom is passable but not sparkly clean. They give you new towels, soap & shampoo everyday. The toilet floor always gets wet because there are no shower curtains. Fragrance hotels do not have shower curtains as well. I don't know if Singaporeans really do not use one. It makes the bathroom really messy. Well, you can't have them all if you're in a budget. I wish though that they will improve on this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheemorz
Reviews.Content: Affordable, Clean and nice hotel. Near to SIM LIM TOWER..Bugis MRT and night market...just a few distance away..

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy and secure at the Mayo Inn”
Reviews.Author: camak
Reviews.Content: Our flights were delayed to Sinagpore which meant our originally booked hostel (Inn Crowd) gave away our room, so we walked around the corner and found this little gem. I believe we payed roughly $70SNG per night for a room on the third floor with a double and single bed. The room was very clean, the sheets were crisp and fresh and the bathroom was spotless. The size of our room was quite cosy, but we had a small fridge, a TV (the reception wasn't the best) and excellent, quiet aircon. Everything was in working order in the room, the beds were very comfy as well. Our room faced the main road, but it wasn't noisy. There are no lifts, but its only a few floors up so the excercise was ok. The owners kept to themselves but they were pleasant enough. Just around the corner was a great hawker center, and a small Indian market. The Little India MRT station was a 5-10min walk away. You're in the Indian quarter, so there's lots of great food close by. There are a few backpackers around the corner with attached pubs if you are feeling thirsty. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a comfortable stay but not looking to pay a lot of money. If you are looking for more than this, like breakfast and a gym, then this is not recommended. I would not recommend this hotel if you have problems walking up and down stairs. I would stay here again as there are a lot of expensive 'budget' places in Singapore (if you're after a private room) but this place was quite clean and good value.
